intro: Hibbertia oenotheroides, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has slender, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and heathlands. Hibbertia oenotheroides is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also an important species for ecological studies.
